intro: Siphocampylus reticulatus var. glabriusculus, commonly known as the smoothleaf siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its varietal name, *glabriusculus*, refers to its smooth, hairless foliage, distinguishing it from other varieties in the species.
